page.title: 13TRADE PORT VALE MARKET.
page.content: On 12th March 1976 an open air market was opened on the car park of Port Vale Footrball Ground.Between March and July 1976 34 traders selling wet fish,greengrocery,fresh meat and various cut price merchandise had stalls on the market.At first the market was the subject of much opposition.In Nov. 1976 the City Council refused planning permission for the market to continue,on the basis of inadequate facilities being provided for the market.However,much of the opposition to the market came from the traders of Burslem district shopping centre who felt that the market would attract customers away from the town centre shops. In Feb.1977 the City Council granted planning permission for a limited period,following a public inquiry in Stoke.
